channel.title: America on stage
channel.description:
Selected American plays written prior to 1900. Each is an expression of contemporary popular sentiments. Radio adaptations of theatre performances, using selected excerpts.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: "Shenandoah" by Bronson Howard
item.description: This program presents a radio play of Shenandoah by Bronson Howard (1888).
item.dc:creator: Kerwin, Jonathan W.
item.dc:subject: Howard, Bronson, 1842-1908

item.title: The Lion of the West
item.description: This program presents a staging of James Kirke Paulding's 1830 play, "The Lion of the West."
item.dc:creator: Kerwin, Jonathan W.
item.dc:subject: Crockett, Davy, 1786-1836--Fiction.

item.title: "Fashion" by Anna Cora Mowatt
item.description: This program presents a radio play of Fashion by Anna Cora Mowatt (1845).
item.dc:creator: Kerwin, Jonathan W.
item.dc:subject: Ritchie, Anna Cora Ogden Mowatt, 1819-1870--Drama.

item.title: "Metamora" by Robert M. Bird
item.description: This program presents a radio play of Metamora by Robert M. Bird (1836).
item.dc:creator: Kerwin, Jonathan W.
item.dc:subject: Bird, Robert Montgomery, 1806-1854

item.title: "Pocahontas" by John Brougham
item.description: This program presents a radio play of Pocahontas by John Brougham (1850).

item.dc:subject: Boker, George H. (George Henry), 1823-1890

item.title: "Minstrel Shows" from 1830
item.description: This program presents excerpts from the various minstrel shows.

item.dc:subject: Minstrel shows.
